description: You are given a 0-indexed positive integer array nums and a positive integer k. A pair of numbers (num1, num2) is called excellent if the following conditions are satisfied: Return the number of distinct excellent pairs. Two pairs (a, b) and (c, d) are considered distinct if either a != c or b != d. For example, (1, 2) and (2, 1) are distinct. Note that a pair (num1, num2) such that num1 == num2 can also be excellent if you have at least one occurrence of num1 in the array.
